bioghist.p: Job Slatford and wife Hannah came to Ann Arbor in 1832. Job Slatford was a carpenter, but with the discovery of gold in California, he and one of his sons, John, set out for the gold field in 1851. Unfortunately, Job Slatford died on the way.

Another of the eight children born to Job and Hannah Slatford was Jane Slatford Bird (born October 6, 1824; died November 29, 1907). Married to John C. Bird on November 5, 1844, she spent most of her life farming and maintaining a peach and apple orchard.

John Bird was the son of Elijah Bird who was born October 1810 in Morris County, New York. Like Job and Hannah Slatford, Elijah Bird had originally come to Ann Arbor in 1832. He thereafter moved to a farm in Argentine in Genesee County, Michigan, then to Linden in 1866.

scopecontent.p: The Slatford and Bird family papers were collected by Julia Bird Martin, who was the great grand-daughter of Job Slatford and grand-daughter of Jane Slatford Bird. The collection consists of family correspondence from various members of both the Slatford and Bird families. The collection not only relates to family matters, but also includes letters of John Slatford written from the California gold fields, 1851-1853. In addition there are clippings, photographs, postcards, and family memorabilia.
